The claim was published on Facebook on A: 2020, and has been shared more than 21,000 times.
The Tagalog text overlay on the image tr: In 2003, the Philippines promptly issued a travel ban so those with SARS virus could not enter the country. We were the only country in Asia without SARS. Now in 2020, (President Rodrigo) Duterte did not immediately issue a travel ban and that’s why we’re already leading in COVID 19 cases in Asia."
There is no record of a travel ban being: The executive order issued by then-President Gloria Macapagal Arroyo on April 26, 2003, instructs "rigid screening" and "strict arrival and departure inspections" but does not mention a ban.
The claim that the Philippines has the h: 19 cases in Asia is not supported by data. As of September 4, 2020, the Philippines had recorded 228,403 confirmed cases, but this is not the highest number in Asia according to the global tally by Johns Hopkins University.
